VIM_TOOLTIP: Type of environment for which to generate the blueprint.
ORCH_TOOLTIP: Select orchestrator for which blueprint is to be generated.
VNF_TOOLTIP: Function of VNF i.e. Router, Loadbalancer etc.
VNF_DESCRIPTION_TOOLTIP: Enter a description for the VNF.
FLAVOR_TOOLTIP: Select an existing flavor to be used or select 'Custom' to enter flavor parameters
FLAVOR_NAME_TOOLTIP: Specify name for the custom flavor
VNFD_NAME_TOOLTIP: VNF name must be one word with no space and special characters.
IMAGE: Unique identifier of the existing VNF image in target environment
CREATE: Provide a URL or Upload a file and provide the filename.
CONFIGURE: Provide a URL or Upload a file and provide the filename.
DELETE: Provide a URL or Upload a file and provide the filename.
INIT: Provide a URL or Upload a Cloud Init script and provide the filename.
DISK: Choose disk size between 0.1 GB to 1000 GB
GENERAL_NIC: Select number of virtual NICs for the VNF
GENERAL_SCRIPTS: Provide script URL. For bash scripts VNF IP is exposed as env variable $HOST_IP
GIT_TOOLTIP: Select this to upload package to GitHub
DOWNLOAD_TOOLTIP: Click button to download the generated VNF package
NIC_INTERFACE_TOOLTIP: VMXNET3 is only available in VMware vCD or VIO environments, and VIRTIO is only for KVM environments.
OS_NIC_INTERFACE_TOOLTIP: 'macvtap' is not supported on VIO environments
MEMORY_RESERVATION_TOOLTIP: Select this to enable large memory pages. If network interface is SR-IOV, memory reservation is 100%
LATENCY_SENSITIVITY_TOOLTIP: Select this if this VNF is Latency Sensitive
NUMA_AFFINITY_TOOLTIP: Select this if this VNF is Numa Aware
NUMBER_NUMA_NODES_TOOLTIP: Select the number of Numa nodes
SCRIPT_INFO_TOOLTIP: Please ensure the configuration script is as per the format required by the orchestrator
LOGIN_INFO_TOOLTIP: This tool supports Mozilla Firefox and Chrome only.
AD_NETWORK_TOOLTIP: Enter No. of networks in addition to mgmt network
MGMT_NETWORK_TOOLTIP: Enter name of the netwrok for Management traffic
VMDK_TOOLTIP: Enter valid vmdk file name with vmdk extension.
HUGE_PAGE_TOOLTIP: Select this to enable huge page support.
